column3:
"installed" < Hr ago. Slow start on my Moto. Fctns seem comprehensive. MUCH 
better than MS WIndose Sci Calc. LACKs 3 memorys for (X,Y,Z). SHARP 1984 
Pocket Computers helped design US I-670. They did 12-digit Sci BASIC. Sold 
my H-P when I found SHARP PC1500. !

This is a great calculator, I like it very much, but it is too slow to 
start, hope to be improved.
I love it. But, please change the app icon for calculator icon.

Generally pretty good, and makes a good job of looking like an FX-995. 
However, as an engineer, the lack of an ENG button to change results to 
nano, micro, milli etc is a bit of an issue. If the developer wants to 
replicate an FX-115D or FX-991D (not FX-991MS/EX/ES etc) that would be 
something I...Full ReviewGenerally pretty good, and makes a good job of looking like an FX-995. 
However, as an engineer, the lack of an ENG button to change results to 
nano, micro, milli etc is a bit of an issue. If the developer wants to 
replicate an FX-115D or FX-991D (not FX-991MS/EX/ES etc) that would be 
something I'd quite happily pay for!

I like to figure problems in my head just to waste time. This app makes it 
easier to learn. Some people find my hobby boring. I kinda like it. :)

Good app. The "LCD" display looks very realistic. Thanks for answering my 
question, I was confused but you set me straight.

I've been using HIPER Calc, arguably a much better calculator. But this one 
is quite good (faithful and realistic to the device it tried to emulate), I 
think I had to put it to my preferred app list

Three stars means "It's OK", but it's not really. Many folks know that the 
cosine of any ODD integral multiple of 90° or π/2 rads is 0 (zero), but not 
according to this calculator. These same folks know that the sine of a 
non-zero integral multiple of 180° or π rads is also 0 (zero), but again 
n...Full ReviewThree stars means "It's OK", but it's not really. Many folks know that the 
cosine of any ODD integral multiple of 90° or π/2 rads is 0 (zero), but not 
according to this calculator. These same folks know that the sine of a 
non-zero integral multiple of 180° or π rads is also 0 (zero), but again 
not according to this calculator. Also, according to this calculator, the 
tangent of an ODD integral multiple of 90° actually has a numerical value, 
and it's cotangent is not zero either. Really? These are pretty basic 
errors that should have been corrected in the early stages of this app's 
development.
Nice work. need to make screen blink after entering same number in screen e.g. 2*2 must blink when 2nd 2 entered.
Love it. Just like my calculators I used at school / college 30 years ago.  Now I always have one. I
Awesome. Gives same feeling of scientific calculator used physically. Exactly same.
Just like the real thing, great.
Excellent app. Just what I was looking for.
Keyboard too busy, No complex numbers.
Nice ! Wish there was fx-100 emulation because it has imaginary numbers and ENG number format

Just like the vintage scientific calculators I used.  Please add option to disable haptic feedback and speed up app loading time (takes longer to open compared to other scientific calcs in Play Store).
Real CASIO fx-990 & fx-995(with solar panel). Remembering my old days of 1985. The Golden days. A very good calculator. I was student of Army Burn Hall College Atd.
THIS IS THE BEST APP IN THE WORLD.
